title: A message to CertainlyT, the designer of Kalista.

replies.body:
She's an overloaded, obnoxious, toxic abomination of a champion just like Yasuo.  She has WAY too much in her kit, in addition to being agonizing to play against with that repulsive hop that makes her look like a kangaroo on crack rather than a malevolent spirit of vengeance. 

For the longest time I thought Yasuo was the biggest middle finger to Riot's design philosophy, but the more I see Kalista...I'm starting to have second thoughts.  Nothing with a kit like that should EVER make it past the drawing board.
Her passive sounds like something you'd think of when drunk to make fun of Riot's current state of balance.
Kalista would be a perfectly viable champion even if she didn't have that passive. They should just move it over to Q (as in only on Q cast) and give her a different one.
The percent damage on her W should be the new passive that scales up with her level.  It's a scout ability after all.
Totes agree. There so much more room to work with once you remove that passive. The power budget suddenly becomes outragiously open to anything.

> [{quoted}](name=Kobila2000,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2015-02-18T20:51:19.748+0000)
>
> Her passive sounds like something you'd think of when drunk to make fun of Riot's current state of balance.

Basically this.  Riot acknowledged mobility creep, then they gave a champ unlimited free mobility. Meanwhile kassadin is crying in the corner.
Kalista makes me miss Yasuo. At least his mobility isn't tied to an auto attack passive.

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=000000010002,timestamp=2015-02-19T04:09:43.157+0000)
>
> Kalista makes me miss Yasuo. At least his mobility isn't tied to an auto attack passive.

He's got more than enough passives to make up for it.

he only has...
...one... two... three...
THREE! only three passives... i think
that's *perfectly* somewhat balanced
Yeah, perfectly somewhat kinda sorta not really balanced at all...meh, looks fine to me. Ship him to the live servers.
Listen to this man. He is wise.

To me, the champs, including Kalista, are really fun to use.  However, when comparing them to the other champions, they tend to all have way more utility loaded into their kits.  That causes people to play them more as it gives a better return for a character slot, and thus pushes out diversity  in the selection pool in matches where people aim to win by using the "best" champs.

Just to jump in, I'm pretty sure this is a clear example of why Riot has no faith in these boards.

This guy is being downvoted to hell for asking a question. Hell, its not even a rhetorical or biased question. He is literally asking "Why?"

Honestly, you guys should really be ashamed of yourselves. Upvote if something is good. But don't downvote because it isn't.
To be fair this posting style was pointed out to riot multiple times before they deleted gd .

> [{quoted}](name=mrhover,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-18T15:22:02.469+0000)
>
> Why do people not like Kalista? I was gonna try her out.

She's a good example of why CertainlyT is one of the most reviled champion designers in the entirety of Riot's staff.

She has free mobility with her passive that procs off of her Q and her auto attacks (BUT SHE LOSES THE ABILITY TO CANCEL AUTOS HOW HORRIFYING) that makes her one of the most, if not most mobile champion in the game given that it requires absolutely nothing from her outside of a half-thought of where to hop to.

Kalista is also the only AD champion in the game with infinite damage potential on an activated nuke that stacks. Unlike Twitch (which is stacked at 7 iirc) or Vayne (Which procs at 3), Kalista can just continue to barrage you with spears while hopping around like a "deranged kangaroo on crack" as a previous poster said. Vayne's Silver Bolts doesn't proc off a Runaan's Hurricane, and Twitch's Expunge only has seven stacks and doesn't slow the victim of the proc anymore to my knowledge. Hell, even THIS GUY --> {{champion:110}}  only gets three stacks to proc his nuke as well.

Then we have the ultimate and virtually free wards + the % of Health nuke that's offered to her and her Oathsworn, which are problematic but not nearly as unhealthy as her jumps or the damage on her E being nigh infinite so long as she doesn't die within the first second of a team fight starting.

I can say without a doubt in my mind that as far as game designers go, CertainlyT is one of my least favorite. Not because he "pushes the envelope", but kind of like the fat kid who gets a can of Pringles, once he pops he can't stop.

She's so insanely mobile that melee champs can't even touch her (without cheese tactics), her kit is overloaded with a skillshot nuke, percent damage, and a free disengage/engage that removes any urgency/agency for her support (or whoever it is she bonded with), and a TRAVELING WARD. As much as I think the idea of an ADC that can hop around is cool and should be in the game, Kalista takes that thought, cranks it to 11, and can literally kite EVERYONE.

> [{quoted}](name=mrhover,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-18T15:22:02.469+0000)
>
> Why do people not like Kalista? I was gonna try her out.

Its because shes op not because shes bad
People are so dumb to down vote a guy asking an innocent question.

All of his champs, barring Darius, just have too much on their kit.  Certaintly T, next champ you make, do it like you normally do.  Then take one of the abilities off.  You'll probably have an awesome champ then.

{{champion:143}} 

I REALLY want to know. How is Zyra's kit overloaded?

> [{quoted}](name=Narasimha,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-02-18T22:36:31.834+0000)
>
> {{champion:143}} 
> 
> I REALLY want to know. How is Zyra's kit overloaded?

I'm assuming you didn't play when she was released? She was arguably on par with release Xin Zhao (if you don't know about that is considered the champion who was the most op on release) and she was nerfed several patches in a row until she's in the state she's in now. Which is hardly ever played and when she is it's usually support.

Being overpowered and having an overloaded kit are not the same thing.

You can be overpowered without having an overloaded kit.
The other way around is harder but not impossible.
Also, Yasuo is pretty balanced atm

> [{quoted}](name=Brzig,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-18T23:05:28.363+0000)
>
> Also, Yasuo is pretty balanced atm

He is also cancerous shit(Balanced cancerous shit,but still).
How is he cancerous?

His kit's got almost as much mobility as Kalista, and he has ridiculous damage and insane power spikes with IE, Shiv, or really anything that gives crit.
His doubled crit is annoying, but the fact that he can jump all over the place and deal ridiculous damage without dying is what makes him annoying.

You forgot the impenetrable cock-blocking fart wall he can put up to stop all projectiles, or the ult that gives him the ability to teleport to you, launch you 15 feet in the air and get free stats for it just because someone sneezed on your champion.
The only unnecessary aspect of her kit was the 20% CDR. No champion should need that passive on their kit. Why can't they just have lower cooldowns?

This man has also brought you

Zed, Thresh, Yasuo, release Darius and release Zyra.

Which with Kalista, this completes the entire list of champs he has ever made to date.

This man....

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-18T15:31:52.141+0000)
>
> This man has also brought you
> 
> Zed, Thresh, Yasuo, release Darius and release Zyra.
> 
> Which with Kalista, this completes the entire list of champs he has ever made to date.
> 
> This man....

Saying "release" in the name of a champion just makes you sound dumb.  They have since bene brough in line so why does it matter?  Will we be complaining about "Release Kalista" in 6 months as if it still matters?  No, we will just be playing the, like people do with Zyra and Darius now.

> [{quoted}](name=Shaabanglyy,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-02-18T21:13:00.330+0000)
>
> Saying "release" in the name of a champion just makes you sound dumb.  They have since bene brough in line so why does it matter?  Will we be complaining about "Release Kalista" in 6 months as if it still matters?  No, we will just be playing the, like people do with Zyra and Darius now.

I disagree,If a champion takes very long to get in line,that is in fact a problem(like if thresh will be considered balanced at some point I will still consider him bad for the 2+ years he's been op),but that's just not the case with zyra and darius.

again,most champions are released op,zyra and darius aren't special on that regard.

> [{quoted}](name=manbearswine,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-02-18T21:50:13.465+0000)
>
> I disagree,If a champion takes very long to get in line,that is in fact a problem(like if thresh will be considered balanced at some point I will still consider him bad for the 2+ years he's been op),but that's just not the case with zyra and darius.
> 
> again,most champions are released op,zyra and darius aren't special on that regard.

I agree with you.  That is why I don't like using the, "Release XXX was OP so the designer is bad" argument.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-18T15:31:52.141+0000)
>release Darius and release Zyra.

Most champions are released op(though things got a bit better after they started releasing them every 2 months),in fact after zyra came diana and rengar,those were pretty fun on release.
This is something most champions do,and both darius and zyra got into a not op spot in a feasible time frame,I hate yasuo/kalista/thresh probably more than most people,but that doesn't mean that every single action certaintlyT does is absolutely horrible and way worse than other designers(we have fizz as a testament to that),at the end of the day(and especially back then) most champions are released op and that really isnt certaintlyT specific.
When someone brings out the Goldblum you know this shit is serious...

But seriously... The flying mechanic is coming guys... I can feel it... What is more broken than unlimited hopping? Flying straight over any jungle terrain.... and I'm not talking as an ultimate. Just a normal passive or something lol.
Ao shin passive. Flies over everything

Wow, that's actually pretty well said.

Well played, Jurassic Park

I don't really blame CertainlyT all that much. He does make some interesting stuff. There should be checks in place that keep his ideas from reaching live servers, and supposedly there are. They just aren't working.

CertainlyT has made some of the best champions in the game. Instead of being balls of stats, they actually introduce new mechanics to the game and are often really fun to play, while requiring at least some skills. 

But eh, better hate the champions then look at your own mistakes and learn how to play better :^)

But they are balls of stats, and 8+ actives and passives.  That's basically all he designs.  I actually played when Xin Zhao was released and it wasn't as bad as everybody talks about it being, it's sorta weird everyone refers to it that way.  Shen was way stronger on release than XZ was imo.

At least back at that time of the game, a brokenly OP character would get hotfixed.  Nowadays you get ones like Kalista who stay retarded for 4 months.  Kalista mains don't want her changed (duh) but seriously Riot can't be this clueless unless they are screwing with us on purpose?

> [{quoted}](name=Minrog,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2015-02-19T00:55:06.448+0000)
>
> But they are balls of stats, and 8+ actives and passives.  That's basically all he designs.  I actually played when Xin Zhao was released and it wasn't as bad as everybody talks about it being, it's sorta weird everyone refers to it that way.  Shen was way stronger on release than XZ was imo.
> 
> At least back at that time of the game, a brokenly OP character would get hotfixed.  Nowadays you get ones like Kalista who stay retarded for 4 months.  Kalista mains don't want her changed (duh) but seriously Riot can't be this clueless unless they are screwing with us on purpose?

???
 no they are not balls of stats. they are more like balls of mechanics. 
 Example : thresh doesnt have that many good stats with 0 souls, but he has a lot of mechanics and play potential. (same with kalista btw)

You know that unlimited stacking mechanics are balls of stats, same with stat->stat transfer mechanics (like what Vlad has for a passive).  Somehow CertainlyT has got enough power to push toxic designs into the live servers and nobody has the power to stop it.

It's asymmetric, as well.  Like there are maybe 8 or 9 champions who follow the new bastardized version of the game and then there are the rest.  It's not only CertainlyT ones that are outside the rules, but also some like Nidalee/Lee Sin ect.

I wouldn't even find Kalista that bad except she has a costless Flash on a .4 second cooldown, a X2 Cho'Gath feast for her E, and provides Malphite's Unstoppable Force to her support.  How many low cooldown ultimates does a single character need?  What's his next character going to have?  Ugh.

> [{quoted}](name=Minrog,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-19T01:20:44.944+0000)
What's his next character going to have?  Ugh.

It will literally be Goku. Every fight makes the champ stronger, and the champ will have multiple transformations that gives stronger and stronger buffs. Eventually giving the ability to instantly teleport anywhere on the map, move at insane speeds, fly over all terrain, and the ult will be a kamehameha wave that destroys the entire rift.

Oh, and cooldown resets on everything.

5 months later they will nerf him so his ult only destroys the enemy side of the rift

> [{quoted}](name=Minrog,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-19T01:20:44.944+0000)
>
> You know that unlimited stacking mechanics are balls of stats, same with stat->stat transfer mechanics (like what Vlad has for a passive).  Somehow CertainlyT has got enough power to push toxic designs into the live servers and nobody has the power to stop it.
> 
> It's asymmetric, as well.  Like there are maybe 8 or 9 champions who follow the new bastardized version of the game and then there are the rest.  It's not only CertainlyT ones that are outside the rules, but also some like Nidalee/Lee Sin ect.
> 
> I wouldn't even find Kalista that bad except she has a costless Flash on a .4 second cooldown, a X2 Cho'Gath feast for her E, and provides Malphite's Unstoppable Force to her support.  How many low cooldown ultimates does a single character need?  What's his next character going to have?  Ugh.

clearly the soul stacking mechanics is what make thresh such a good top tier pick :^), they are some additional stats yes, but not the same as vlad, that you used for your example, who just get stats because he is buildign other stats. Thresh has to get into the creep wave to collect his souls, it put him often in a position where the opponent adc can poke him almost for free.

where you see toxic design, i see interesting new design that enhance the fun of the game, each their own i guess, but its certainly(T) less boring then farming simulator Nasus for instance (even vlad that you named, is basically push wave, sustain, push wave pool if ganked and deals aoe in teamfight. that's not really the most exciting gameplay around)

i dont get the asymmetric argument as well ?  Do you mean you expect 123 champion to have similar kits/play style ? Yes there is different champion that do different things ???

Like most people that are just upset at a champion, you are mistaking her jump for a blink, in fact its closer to a dash then a flash. not the same, as in you can intercept her in movement. Recently, in LCS out of all place, we saw an ahri place a charm on a kalista and destroy her, because the ahri was able to guess where Kalista was jumping to! Remeber these are also pro that have their live income on the line, and they wouldnt pick kalista if the likes of Vi and Kalista are open to grab. This is because, for Kalista to do her Rend (E) damage, she needs to be able to freely auto champions. If you don't think about the champion you pick into Kalista, then guess what you misplay the draft phase of the game ^^ gotta learn to improve that!

Kalista doesnt build CDR, so 90 to 60 sec is about right for her ultimate, between rank 1 and 3, Now lets look at the other 3 utility focus adc@16

{{champion:22}}  Enchanted Crystal Arrow (R) : 80 cd MAGIC DAMAGE:  600 (+ 100% AP) SPLASH DAMAGE: 300 (+ 50% AP) up to 3.5sec stun, 50% slow aoe
{{champion:110}}  Chain of Corruption (R) 70  cd MAGIC DAMAGE: 350 (+ 100% AP) Root for 2sec spread to champion that stay for 2 sec in range (600)
{{champion:15}} On the Hunt (R) 80 cd  80% AS while ricochet is on, 60% move speed for her and her team for 6 sec and then decay to 20% for 2 sec after that
(No i'm not saying these champion are as good as Kalista, they have other parameters to consider, that make them not really as wanted/top tier pick)

So not too far off in term of CD compared to the others, but theirs directly increase damage (by either doing damage, giving passive as, or procing other damage source (for Varus)) while Kalista doesnt have damage attached to her ult. What it does is launching the oathsworn to the a direction knockbacking opponent there for up to 2sec but also putting the support in a relativly bad spot if it wasnt executed properly. It actually require teamwork. Aside of that you can name stuff all wrong to make it sound like its op, it doesnt mean the champion is op. 

Maybe you should just try to improve your own game instead of QQing in the board ?
I love how you mentioned Varus having to proc his damage but didn't talk about how much more easily Kalista can proc her infinite scaling damage.
Stop complaining and learn to play....

> [{quoted}](name=Mutsu Hanma,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3qExG5Ij,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2015-02-19T15:44:52.540+0000)
>
> Stop complaining and learn to play....

You almost had me laughing but i realized that you are serious. :D

{{champion:44}}: don't move... her vision is based on movement O__O

{{champion:67}}: that's {{champion:421}} your thinking of
{{champion:44}}: ...oh god...
Her kits, uh, umm, uh, toxic.
